content: What is the most straightforward method to add all items from an iterable to an existing set in Python?

The most straightforward method to add all items from an iterable to an existing set in Python is to use the `update()` method of the set. The `update()` method takes an iterable as an argument and adds all its elements to the set. Here's an example:

```python
# Existing set
my_set = {1, 2, 3}

# Iterable (e.g., list)
my_iterable = [4, 5, 6]

# Add all items from the iterable to the set
my_set.update(my_iterable)

print(my_set)
```

After executing the above code, `my_set` will be `{1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}`. This method is efficient and concise for adding multiple elements to a set.
